decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with cheap reanimation spells such as Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also utilizes cards like Collective Brutality and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own combo pieces. The key strategy is to cheat out massive threats like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance its creatures' abilities. Additionally, the deck has strong utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to control the battlefield and keep the opponent on the back foot. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and disrupt the opponent's resources to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also generating card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Kolaghan's Command, along with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Leovold, Emissary of Trest helps to lock the opponent out of drawing extra cards, while Deathrite Shaman provides additional disruption and mana acceleration. Overall, the deck focuses on mana efficiency and card advantage to outlast the opponent and secure the win.

The main concept of this combo-Food Chain deck is to use cards like Manipulate Fate and Misthollow Griffin to generate infinite mana with Food Chain. This allows the player to cast Walking Ballista repeatedly for lethal damage. Leovold, Emissary of Trest helps disrupt the opponent's plans while Baleful Strix and Deathrite Shaman provide additional utility. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to control the board. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can respond.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to use efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and disruption spells like Stifle. The deck aims to control the board through tempo plays while dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt and finishing the opponent off with key threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler. The mana base is focused on providing the necessary colors for spells while also leveraging Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana sources and rituals to generate a large amount of mana quickly, then using card draw and selection spells to dig for combo pieces. The goal is to assemble the necessary cards to cast Ad Nauseam, drawing through the deck to find the win condition. Burning Wish provides additional flexibility and access to sideboard cards, while Cabal Therapy and Duress disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently and explosively combo off to overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman to quickly put pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells such as Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle to keep the opponent off balance. The mana base consists of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent color access. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find key cards. Overall, the deck aims to establish an aggressive board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and casting multiple spells in a single turn to build up a storm count, eventually casting a lethal Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent. It uses cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, along with cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to dig for combo pieces. Cabal Therapy and Duress provide disruption for the opponent, while Past in Flames allows for spell recursion. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using cheap spells and disruptive creatures to quickly take control of the game and apply pressure to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to constantly stay one step ahead of the opponent and disrupt their game plan. With access to powerful tempo cards like Daze and Force of Will, the deck can easily protect its threats and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this Legacy Combo - Dredge deck is to rapidly fill the graveyard with dredge creatures and combo pieces using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough. By utilizing the powerful dredge mechanic, the deck aims to quickly generate zombie tokens with Bridge from Below and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence. The deck also includes disruption elements like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo. The key strategy is to outpace and overpower the opponent through graveyard manipulation and aggressive creature plays.

This deck focuses on control through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Monastery Mentor to generate value and dominate the late game. The deck also includes efficient removal in the form of Swords to Plowshares and Punishing Fire, along with a suite of cantrips to maintain card quality. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, this UWx Control deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and win through a combination of card advantage and superior board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to use the Aluren combo to cast creatures like Baleful Strix and Cavern Harpy for free, allowing for a powerful synergy and card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Force of Will to control the game. Ancestral Vision and Brainstorm provide card draw and selection, while Deathrite Shaman helps with mana fixing and disruption. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent with efficient combos and well-timed interaction.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain control of the board while aggressively attacking the opponent. By utilizing efficient and versatile spells like Lightning Bolt, Stifle, and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and quickly deal damage with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Young Pyromancer. The deck also includes a mix of powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler. Additionally, the deck runs a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's resources.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Hymn to Tourach, while generating card advantage with Brainstorm, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Baleful Strix and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to put pressure on the opponent while providing additional value. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a long game.

The key concept of the deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive cards like Back to Basics. The deck aims to generate card advantage and tempo with cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage while also having a strong late game with powerful finishers like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic. The inclusion of equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte gives the deck additional ways to close out the game efficiently. Ultimately, the deck looks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a grindy control matchup.

This deck focuses on establishing early control over the opponent by utilizing powerful disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Blood Moon. It aims to quickly lock the opponent out of casting their spells while deploying aggressive threats such as Goblin Rabblemaster and Hazoret the Fervent to swiftly close out the game. The deck leverages its mana acceleration through cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to deploy its powerful threats ahead of schedule, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of disruptive elements and robust creatures.
